page.title: 18The Farm Museum-Laughton, 2
page.content: cost. When the Farm Museum started in 1981, the buildings were in a terrible state and the farmhouse was dangerous because it was collapsing. Mr. Barrett set the naughty boys to work rebuilding, which they did. The site isn't just going to be a farm museum, it is also going to be about life between 1850 and 1950. Mr. Barrett said that farmers throw very little machinery away, so all he had to do was ask around and collect things. He said that the museum now had lots of machinery which had been restored to its original condition. Mr. Barrett said that they had more than a thousand small tools. Also in the museum there is a blacksmith's shop complete with hearth and bellows along with lots of other craftmen's tools for people to see.
